result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamell M. Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Managment and AODA.  No contact w/victim (C.F.) or Kalahari Resort.  Defendant has 47 days credit if probation revoked.  Restitution to be determined within 30 days.

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Jamell M. Ward in court with attorney Mark David Lawton.  Defendant Jamell M. Ward in custody.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties rec/rev revocation summary and Atty Lawton notes JOC doesn't show any pre-sentence credit and there should be 47 days credit in this matter.  State agrees and makes their recommendations.  Atty Lawton makes his recommendations.  DE makes statement.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Ct 1:
One year jail w/huber consecutive to any other sentence
334 days sentence credit for TIME SERVED sentence
Any outstanding court obligations to be converted to a civil judgment

Court states case and State states appearances.  Atty Viney states recs.  State is in agreement.  Atty Viney enters NC plea.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on plea/accepts/finds guilty and sentences.  Court advises DE re: felony firearms/voting rights.

Defendant Jamell M. Ward appeared by video means with Attorney ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Michael X. Albrecht appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Joseph L Viney in court as well.  Court reviews file and warrant history.  Attorney ORourke gives explanation for non appearance.  Gives new address.  State request $2,000.00 cash bond along with original no contacts in place.  State gives warrant history.  Attorney ORourke objects to cash bond.  Court sets $500.00 CASH bond.  Conditions originally set remain in effect.   No contact w/C.F. or Kalahari Resort or C.W.   Matter will be placed back on the trial calendar.  Appoitment of Attorney Viney continues.

body

Attorney Joseph L Viney in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Viney has had little contact.  State request warrant.  Court suggests stay of warrant.  State request no stay.    Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.  Trial remains on and matter to be discussed with Br. 2.
Jury trial at 10-06-2015 08:30 am
Final pre-trial at 09-28-2015 01:00 pm
Atty Viney acknowledges rec. information, waives reading and stands mute.  Court enters NG plea - matter to be set for trial.  Bond continued.

Defendant Jamell M. Ward in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Viney notes DE will waive prelim today.  DE agrees.  Court quashes any warrant and questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause and binds over.
Hearing at 07-17-2015 01:00 pm

Attorney Joseph L Viney in court.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing to be held today.  DE has not made it to the atty's office for review discovery.  Atty. Viney has no idea why DE not here.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stayed.  Hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing at 07-10-2015 09:45 am

Defendant Jamell M. Ward in court with attorney Joseph L Viney.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Viney request preliminary hearing.  Time limits waived.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 10, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Pre-trial conference at 06-05-2015 10:45 am.
Return date at 06-17-2015 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jamell M. Ward in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE re: his application for PD appt.  DE has not filled out application for court-appointed attorney.  Court provides the form to the  DE to fill out and will recall the case.  Court recalls case later, the State is no longer present.  Court questions DE on income/assets.  Court finds DE conditionally indigent and appoints Atty Joe Viney (137 3rd Ave, Baraboo (608) 356-2159).  To reimburse COC's office $25/bi-weekly beginning on or before 6/2/2015 and then every other week thereafter until the Court orders those payments to stop.  DE works for Concept Attractions in Wisconsin Dells at 105 Broadway.  If the employer doesn't take the money out of the checks the DE is responsible for making those payments.  Court resets PTC and RD.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 10:45 am.  Return date scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
PD Eligibility Form
Indigency hearing at 05-11-2015 02:30 pm
Return date at 05-20-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Jamell M. Ward in court.  Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE on counsel.  DE doesn't want more time to get counsel.  Court advises DE of right to counsel.  DE now wants more time to talk to the PD's office about counsel.  Court agrees to reset one more time.  Bond continued.  Return date scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
No contact w/C.F, C.W. or Kalahari Resort

Pre-trial conference at 04-24-2015 11:00 am.
Return date at 05-06-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Jamell M. Ward appeared by video means from LEC w/atty. Deb ORourke. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  State requests $1500 Cash.  Requests Preliminary hearing; Time limits waived.  $2500.00 Signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact w/C.F. or Kalahari Resort or C.W.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 11:00 am.  Return date scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
